meanings.definition: Constructing or assembling parts of a building before they are brought to the final construction site.
meanings.sent1: The prebuilding of the walls and roof helped speed up the construction process.
meanings.sent2: The company specialized in prebuilding sections of houses to save time on-site.
meanings.sent3: The prebuilding of the structure was so efficient that the workers had time for a coffee break.
meanings.sent4: The prebuilding stage was like putting together a giant puzzle before the big reveal.
meanings.sent5: The prebuilding process made the project feel like magic, with pieces coming together seamlessly.

meanings.definition: The act of preparing or planning a building project in advance.
meanings.sent1: Proper prebuilding ensures that the project stays on schedule and within budget.
meanings.sent2: The success of the prebuilding phase determined the smoothness of the entire construction project.
meanings.sent3: The prebuilding meeting turned into a brainstorming session for innovative ideas.
meanings.sent4: The prebuilding work laid the foundation for a successful and stress-free construction period.
meanings.sent5: The prebuilding preparation was like drawing a detailed map before starting a long journey.
